name: Dev-guides
tagline: Technical information and pointers to get started with development
body:
# dev-guides

## Courses

### COSC 4330: Fundamentals of Operating Systems:

Since network programming with sockets in C is a classic programming assignment
for the OS course, the following resources may be helpful:

* [Beej's Guide to Network Programming Using Internet
  Sockets](http://www.beej.us/guide/bgnet/) is a good site with lots of practical
  examples.
* W. Richard Stevens' [UNIX Network Programming](http://www.kohala.com/start/unpv12e.html)
  may be relatively old, but it is comprehensive. If you want to learn just
  about everything about Unix sockets, this is it.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
